(JOURNAL)
WEDNESDAY, JUNE 22, 1983
721
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES
Present: Chief Justice Burger, Justice Brennan, Justice White, Jus-
tice Marshall, Justice Blackmun, Justice Powell, Justice Rehnquist,
Justice Stevens, and Justice O'Connor.
OPINIONS
No. 81-89. Walter Zant, Warden, Petitioner v. Alpha Otis O'Daniel
Stephens. On writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals
for the Fifth Circuit. Judgment reversed and case remanded to the
Court of Appeals for further proceedings in conformity with the opinion
of this Court. Opinion by Justice Stevens. Opinion by Justice White
concurring in part and concurring in the judgment. Opinion by Justice
Rehnquist concurring in the judgment. Dissenting opinion by Justice
Marshall with whom Justice Brennan joins.
No. 82-65. Margaret R. Brown, et al., Appellants v. Thyra Thomson,
Secretary of State of Wyoming, et al. Appeal from the United States
District Court for the District of Wyoming. Judgment affirmed. Opin-
ion by Justice Powell. Concurring opinion by Justice O'Connor with
whom Justice Stevens joins. Dissenting opinion by Justice Brennan
with whom Justice White, Justice Marshall, and Justice Blackmun
joins.
No. 81-1304. National Association of Greeting Card Publishers, Peti-
tioner v. United States Postal Service, et al.; and
No. 81-1381. United Parcel Service of America, Inc., Petitioner v.
United States Postal Service, et al. On writs of certiorari to the United
States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit. Judgment affirmed and
cases remanded to the Court of Appeals for further proceedings in con-
formity with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by Justice Blackmun.
No. 82-11. Mennonite Board of Missions, Appellant v. Richard C.
Adams. Appeal from the Court of Appeals of Indiana. Judgment re-
versed and case remanded to the Court of Appeals for further proceed-
ings not inconsistent with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by Justice
Marshall. Dissenting opinion by Justice O'Connor with whom Justice
Powell and Justice Rehnquist join.
No. 81-2057. Alan J. Karcher, Speaker, New Jersey Assembly, et
al., Appellants v. George T. Daggett, et al. Appeal from the United

722
WEDNESDAY, JUNE 22, 1983
States District Court for the District of New Jersey. Judgment af-
firmed. Opinion by Justice Brennan. Concurring opinion by Justice Ste-
vens. Dissenting opinion by Justice White with whom the Chief Justice,
Justice Powell, and Justice Rehnquist joins. Dissenting opinion by Jus-
tice Powell.
Adjourned until tomorrow at 10 o'clock.

(JOURNAL)
THURSDAY, JUNE 23, 1983
723
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES
Present: Chief Justice Burger, Justice Brennan, Justice White, Jus-
tice Marshall, Justice Blackmun, Justice Powell, Justice Rehnquist, and
Justice Stevens.
OPINIONS
No. 81-1857. Oregon, Petitioner v. James Edward Bradshaw. On
writ of certiorari to the Court of Appeals of Oregon. Judgment re-
versed and case remanded to the Court of Appeals for further proceed-
ings not inconsistent with the opinion of this Court. Justice Rehnquist
announced the judgment of the Court and delivered an opinion in which
the Chief Justice, Justice White, and Justice O'Connor join. Opinion by
Justice Powell concurring in the judgment. Dissenting opinion by Jus-
tice Marshall with whom Justice Brennan, Justice Blackmun, and Jus-
tice Stevens join.
No. 67, Original. State of Idaho, ex rel. John V. Evans, Governor;
Jim Jones, Attorney General; Jerry M. Conley, Director, Department
of Fish and Game, Plaintiffs v. States of Oregon and Washington. On
Exceptions to the Final Report of the Special Master. The recommen-
dation of the Special Master is adopted, and the action is dismissed
without prejudice. Opinion by Justice Blackmun. Dissenting opinion by
Justice O'Connor with whom Justice Brennan and Justice Stevens join.
No. 80–1832. Immigration and Naturalization Service, Appellant v.
Jagdish Rai Chadha, et al.;
No. 80–2170. United States House of Representatives, Petitioner v.
Immigration and Naturalization Service, et al.; and
No. 80-2171. United States Senate, Petitioner v. Immigration and
Naturalization Service, et al. On writs of certiorari to the United States.
Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. Judgment affirmed. Opinion by
the Chief Justice. Opinion by Justice Powell concurring in the judg-
ment. Dissenting opinion by Justice White. Dissenting opinion by Jus-
tice Rehnquist with whom Justice White joins.
Adjourned until tomorrow at 10 o'clock.

(JOURNAL)
FRIDAY, JUNE 24, 1983
725
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES
Present: Justice Brennan, Justice White, Justice Marshall, Justice
Blackmun, Justice Powell, Justice Rehnquist, and Justice Stevens.
OPINIONS
No. 81-1985. Edward J. DeBartolo Corp., Petitioner v. National
Labor Relations Board, et al. On writ of certiorari to the United States
Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit. Judgment vacated and case
remanded to the Court of Appeals for further proceedings in conformity
with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by Justice Stevens.
No. 81-2245. Nevada, Petitioner v. United States, et al.;
No. 81-2276. Truckee-Carson Irrigation District, Petitioner v.
United States, et al.; and
No. 82–38. Pyramid Lake Paiute Tribe of Indians, Petitioner v.
Truckee-Carson Irrigation District, et al. On writs of certiorari to the
United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. Judgment af-
firmed in part, reversed in part and cases remanded to Court of appeals
for further proceedings in conformity with the opinion of this court.
Opinion by Justice Rehnquist. Concurring opinion by Justice Brennan.
No. 81-1578. Robert R. Shaw, Acting Commissioner, etc., et al., Ap-
pellants v. Delta Air Lines, Inc., et al.; Robert R. Shaw, Acting Com-
missioner, etc., Appellant v. Burroughs Corporation; Robert R. Shaw,
Acting Commissioner, etc., et al., Appellants v. Metropolitan Life In-
surance Company. Appeal from the United States Court of Appeals for
the Second Circuit. Judgments affirmed in part, vacated in part and
cases remanded to the Court of Appeals for further proceedings in con-
formity with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by Justice Blackmun.
No cost allowed.
No. 81-1590. William F. Bolger, et al., Appellants v. Youngs Drug
Products Corp. Appeal from the United States District Court for the
District of Columbia. Judgment affirmed. Opinion by Justice Marshall.
Opinion by Justice Rehnquist concurring in the judgment with whom
Justice O'Connor joins. Opinion by Justice Stevens concurring in the
judgment. Justice Brennan took no part in decision of this case.
No. 82-354. Motor Vehicle Manufacturers Association of the United
States, Inc., et al., Petitioners v. State Farm Mutual Automobile Insur-
ance Company, et al.;

726
FRIDAY, JUNE 24, 1983
No. 82-355. Consumer Alert, et al., Petitioners v. State Farm Mu-
tual Automobile Insurance Company, et al.; and
No. 82–398. United States Department of Transportation, et al., Pe-
titioners v. State Farm Mutual Automobile Insurance Co., et al. On
writs of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the District
of Columbia Circuit. Judgment vacated and cases remanded to the
Court of Appeals with directions to remand the matter to the National
Highway Traffic Safety Administration for further consideration in con-
formity with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by Justice White. Opin-
ion by Justice Rehnquist concurring in part and dissenting in part with
whom the Chief Justice, Justice Powell, and Justice O'Connor join.
No. 82–695. Franchise Tax Board of the State of California, Appel-
lant v. Construction Laborers Vacation Trust for Southern California,
et al. Appeal from the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth
Circuit. Judgment vacated and case remanded to the Court of Appeals
so that this case may be remanded to the Superior Court of California,
County of Los Angeles. Opinion by Justice Brennan.
Adjourned until Monday, June 27, 1983 at 10 o'clock.

(JOURNAL)
MONDAY, JUNE 27, 1983
727
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES
Present: Chief Justice Burger, Justice Brennan, Justice White, Jus-
tice Marshall, Justice Blackmun, Justice Powell, Justice Rehnquist,
Justice Stevens, and Justice O'Connor.
The Chief Justice said:
"Today's orders of the Court have been certified by the Chief Justice,
filed with the Clerk, and will not be announced orally.'
APPEALS SUMMARY DISPOSITION
"
No. 82–268. First Pennsylvania Bank, N.A., Appellant v. Lancaster
County Tax Claim Bureau and Della Becker. Appeal from the Supreme
Court of Pennsylvania, Eastern District. The judgment is vacated and
the case is remanded to the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania, Eastern
District, for further consideration in light of Mennonite Board of Mis-
sions v. Adams, 462 U.S. (1983).
-
No. 82–1745. Katherine Marie Pascoe, Appellant v. I. Kuehnast. Ap-
peal from the Court of Appeals of Texas, Tenth Supreme Judicial Dis-
trict. The appeal is dismissed for want of jurisdiction.
No. 82-6726. Randolph E. Neal, Jr., Appellant v. Alabama. Appeal
from the United States District Court for the Northern District of Ala-
bama. The appeal is dismissed for want of jurisdiction.
CERTIORARI-SUMMARY DISPOSITION
No. 81-307. Claude K. West, Petitioner v. United States. On petition
for writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the First
Circuit. The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. The judgment is
vacated and the case is remanded to the United States Court of Appeals
for the First Circuit for further consideration in light of United States
v. Place, 462 U.S. (1983).
No. 81-935. Jeffboat, Inc., Petitioner v. Paul Robertson, Adminis-
trator of the Estate of William L. Robertson. On petition for writ of
certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit.
The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. The judgment is vacated
and the case is remanded to the United States Court of Appeals for the
Sixth Circuit for further consideration in light of Jones & Laughlin
Steel Corporation v. Pfeifer, 462 U.S. — (1983).
No. 82-650. Sharon Margaret Pavlak, Petitioner v. John R. Church,
etc., et al. On petition for writ of certiorari to the United States Court
of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. The petition for writ of certiorari is

728
MONDAY, JUNE 27, 1983
granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the
United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit for further consid-
eration in light of Crown, Cork & Seal Company, Inc. v. Parker, 462
U.S. (1983) and Chardon v. Fumero Soto, 462 U.S.
-
- _
- (1983).
No. 82-667. Florida, Petitioner v. Silvio P. Zafra. On petition for
writ of certiorari to the District Court of Appeal of Florida, Third Dis-
trict. The motion of respondent for leave to proceed in forma pauperis
is granted. The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. The judgment
is vacated and the case is remanded to the District Court of Appeal of
Florida, Third District, for further consideration in light of United
States v. Villamonte-Marquez, 462 U.S. — (1983).
No. 82–674. United States, Petitioner v. John Christopher Beale. On
petition for writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for
the Ninth Circuit. The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. The
judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the United States
Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit for further consideration in light
of United States v. Place, 462 U.S. (1983).
No. 82-853. Russell Creek Land Company, et al., Petitioners v.
Charjuan, Inc. On petition for writ of certiorari to the Circuit Court of
Cabell County, West Virginia. The petition for writ of certiorari is
granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the Cir-
cuit Court of Cabell County, West Virginia for further consideration in
light of Mennonite Board of Missions v. Adams, 462 U.S. (1983).
-
No. 82-948. Illinois, Petitioner v. Warren L. Bean. On petition for
writ of certiorari to the Appellate Court of Illinois, Third District. The
motion of respondent for leave to proceed in forma pauperis is granted.
The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. The judgment is vacated
and the case is remanded to the Appellate Court of Illinois, Third Dis-
trict, for further consideration in light of Illinois v. Lafayette, 462 U.S.
(1983).
No. 82–1006. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, Peti-
tioner v. Lockheed Missiles & Space Company, Inc. On petition for writ
of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Cir-
cuit. The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. The judgment is va-
cated and the case is remanded to the United States Court of Appeals
for the Ninth Circuit for further consideration in light of Newport News
Shipbuilding and Dry Dock Company v. Equal Employment Opportu-
nity Commission, 462 U.S. ——— (1983).
No. 82–1365. Continental Insurance Company, Petitioner v. Sister
Riccarda Moseley, etc., et al. On petition for writ of certiorari to

MONDAY, JUNE 27, 1983
729
the Supreme Court of Nevada. The petition for writ of certiorari is
granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the Su-
preme Court of Nevada for further consideration in light of Mennonite
Board of Missions v. Adams, 462 U.S. (1983).
No. 82–1857. Washington, Petitioner v. Dwayne Earl Bartholomew.
On petition for writ of certiorari to the Supreme Court of Washington.
The motion of respondent for leave to proceed in forma pauperis is
granted. The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. The judgment is
vacated and the case is remanded to the Supreme Court of Washington
for further consideration in light of Zant v. Stephens, 462 U.S.
(1983). Justice Brennan and Justice Marshall would deny certiorari.
ORDERS IN PENDING CASES
No.
Benjamin Detenber, et al., Petitioners v. Thomas K.
Turnage, Director, Selective Service System, et al. The motion to di-
rect the Clerk to file the petition for writ of certiorari out-of-time is
denied.
No. A-1000. Ralph Irving Abravaya, Applicant v. United States.
The application for stay addressed to Justice Stevens and by him re-
ferred to the Court is denied.
No. D-334. In the Matter of Disbarment of Lawrence M. Aglow. Dis-
barment entered.
No. D-353. In the Matter of Disbarment of Raymond T. Greene. It
having been reported to the Court that Raymond T. Greene died No-
vember 5, 1982, the Rule to Show Cause, heretofore issued on June 6,
1983, is hereby, discharged.
No. D-354. In the Matter of Disbarment of Robert John Connolly.
Robert John Connolly, of Tacoma, Washington, having requested to re-
sign as a member of the Bar of this Court, it is ordered that his name be
stricken from the roll of attorneys admitted to practice before the Bar
of this Court. The Rule to Show Cause, heretofore issued on June 6,
1983, is hereby, discharged.
No. D-364. In the Matter of Disbarment of John P. Downes. It is or-
dered that John P. Downes, of Oxon Hill, Maryland, be suspended from
the practice of law in this Court and that a rule issue, returnable within
forty days, requiring him to show cause why he should not be disbarred
from the practice of law in this Court.
No. 80, Original. State of Colorado, Plaintiff v. State of New Mexico
and Paul G. Bardacke, Attorney General of New Mexico. The Report of
the Special Master containing additional factual findings requested by

730
MONDAY, JUNE 20, 1983
order of Court is received and ordered filed. Exceptions to the Report,
with supporting briefs, may be filed by the parties within 45 days. Re-
plies to the Exceptions, with supporting briefs, may be filed within 30
days.
No. 86, Original. State of Louisiana, Plaintiff v. State of Mississippi,
et al. The Report of the Special Master is received and ordered filed.
Exceptions to the Report, with supporting briefs, may be filed by the
parties with 45 days. Replies to the Exceptions, with supporting briefs,
may be filed within 30 days.
No. 81-1304. National Association of Greeting Card Publishers v.
United States Postal Service, et al.; and
No. 81-1381. United Parcel Service of America, Inc., Petitioner v.
United States Postal Service, et al. The motion of the Solicitor General
for leave to file a supplemental brief after argument is granted.
No. 81-2332. Norfolk Redevelopment and Housing Authority, etc. v.
Chesapeake and Potomac Telephone Company of Virginia, et al. The
motion of respondent Brooklyn Union Gas Company for leave to file a
brief as amicus curiae is granted. Justice Powell took no part in the
consideration or decision of this motion.
No. 82-914. Monsanto Company, Petitioner v. Spray-Rite Service
Corporation. The motion of Associates for Antitrust Analysis for leave
to file a brief as amicus curiae is granted. Justice White took no part in
the consideration or decision of this motion.
No. 82-1401. Iain Calder and John South, Appellants v. Shirley
Jones. The motion of The Reporters Committee for Freedom of the
Press, et al. for leave to file a brief as amici curiae is granted. The mo-
tion of Association of American Publishers, Inc. for leave to file a brief
as amicus curiae is granted.
No. 82-2045. Committee to Preserve American Color Television,
etc., et al., Petitioners v. United States. The application to continue the
injunction entered by the United States Court of Appeals for the Fed-
eral Circuit presented to Justice Brennan and by him referred to the
Court is denied.
No. 82-6675. George Gilliam, Petitioner v. 2201 Boardwalk Corp.,
etc., et al. The motion of petitioner for leave to proceed in forma pau-
peris is denied. The petitioner is allowed until July 18, 1983, within
which to pay the docketing fee required by Rule 45(a) and to submit a
petition in compliance with Rule 33 of the Rules of this Court.
No. 82-6702. Edward A. Ganey, Petitioner v. Jacob L. Safron, et al.
The motion of petitioner for leave to proceed in forma pauperis is de-

731
nied. The petitioner is allowed until July 18, 1983, within which to pay
the docketing fee required by Rule 45(a) and to submit a petition in
compliance with Rule 33 of the Rules of this Court.
No. 82-6827. Jack C. Pettee, Petitioner v. Gary Kilpatrick, et al. The
motion of petitioner for leave to proceed in forma pauperis is denied.
The petitioner is allowed until July 18, 1983, within which to pay the
docketing fee required by Rule 45(a) and to submit a petition in compli-
ance with Rule 33 of the Rules of this Court.

OPINIONS
No. 81-1756. Jonathan Lehr, Appellant v. Lorraine Robertson, et al.
Appeal from the Court of Appeals of New York. Judgment affirmed.
Opinion by Justice Stevens. Dissenting opinion by Justice White with
whom Justice Marshall and Justice Blackmun join.
No. 82-63. City of Revere, Petitioner v. Massachusetts General Hos-
pital. On writ of certiorari to the Supreme Judicial Court of Massachu-
setts. Judgment reversed and case remanded to the Supreme Court for
further proceedings not inconsistent with the opinion of this Court.
Opinion by Justice Blackmun. Opinion by Justice Rehnquist concurring
in part and concurring in the judgment with whom Justice White joins.
Opinion by Justice Stevens concurring in the judgment.
No. 81-1748. United States, Petitioner v. Helen Mitchell, et al. On
writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Federal
Circuit. Judgment affirmed and case remanded to the Court of Appeals
for further proceedings in conformity with the opinion of this Court.
Opinion by Justice Marshall. Dissenting opinion by Justice Powell with
whom Justice Rehnquist and Justice O'Connor join.
No. 81-523. Container Corporation of America, Appellant v. Fran-
chise Tax Board. Appeal from the Court of Appeal of California, First
Appellate District. Judgment affirmed. Opinion by Justice Brennan.
Dissenting opinion by Justice Powell with whom the Chief Justice and
Justice O'Connor join. Justice Stevens took no part in the consideration
or decision of this case.
☑
Adjourned until tomorrow at 10 o'clock.

SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES

OPINIONS
No. 82-401. Baxter Rice, individually and as Director of the Depart-
ment of Alcoholic Beverage Control of California, Petitioner v. Eva
Rehner. On writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for
the Ninth Circuit. Judgment reversed and case remanded to the Court
of Appeals for further proceedings in conformity with the opinion of
this Court. Opinion by Justice O'Connor. Dissenting opinion by Justice
Blackmun with whom Justice Brennan and Justice Marshall join.
No. 82-242. William D. Ruckelshaus, Administrator, Environmental
Protection Agency, Petitioner v. Sierra Club, et al. On writ of certio-
rari to the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia
Circuit. Judgment reversed and case remanded to the Court of Appeals
for further proceedings in conformity with the opinion of this Court.
Opinion by Justice Rehnquist announced by the Chief Justice. Dissent-
ing opinion by Justice Stevens with whom Justice Brennan, Justice
Marshall, and Justice Blackmun join.
No. 82–276. Raymond L. Dirks, Petitioner v. Securities and Ex-
change Commission. On writ of certiorari to the United States Court of
Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. Judgment reversed and
case remanded to the Court of Appeals for further proceedings in con-
formity with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by Justice Powell. Dis-
senting opinion by Justice Blackmun with whom Justice Brennan and
Justice Marshall join.
No. 81-431. Guardians Association, etc., et al., Petitioners v. Civil
Service Commission of the City of New York, et al. On writ of certio-
rari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit. Judg-
ment affirmed. Justice White announced the judgment of the Court and
delivered an opinion, in Parts I, III, IV and V of which Justice Rehn-
quist joins. Opinion by Justice Powell concurring in the judgment with
whom the Chief Justice joins, and in Part II of which Justice Rehnquist
joins. Statement by Justice Rehnquist concurring in the judgment.
Opinion by Justice O'Connor concurring in the judgment. Dissenting
opinion by Justice Marshall. Dissenting opinion by Justice Stevens with
whom Justice Brennan and Justice Blackmun join.

752
FRIDAY, JULY 1, 1983
No. 81-2147. Arizona, et al., Petitioners v. San Carlos Apache Tribe
of Arizona, et al.; and Arizona, et al., Petitioners v. Navajo Tribe of
Indians, et al.; and
No. 81-2188. Montana, et al., Petitioners v. Northern Cheyenne
Tribe of the Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation, et al. On writs of
certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.
The motion of the Blackfeet Indian Tribe to suspend all proceedings in
this Court rejecting the water rights of the Blackfeet Indian Tribe,
Browning, Montana, and to preclude the Solicitor General or any other
attorney of the Department of Justice from purporting to represent
that Tribe in these proceedings is denied. The motion of the White
Mountain Apache Tribe and the Blackfeet Indian Tribe for leave to file
a motion to dismiss for lack of in personam and subject matter jurisdic-
tion in this Court over the state court water rights adjudication pro-
ceedings is denied. Treating the papers whereon the motion submitted
as a motion for leave to file a brief amicus curiae, and treating the ac-
companying papers as a brief amicus curiae, leave to file the brief is
granted. Judgments reversed and cases remanded to the Court of Ap-
peals for further proceedings in conformity with the opinion of this
Court. Opinion by Justice Brennan. Dissenting opinion by Justice Mar-
shall. Dissenting opinion by Justice Stevens with whom Justice Black-
mun joins.
Adjourned until Tuesday, July 5, 1983 at 10 o'clock.

(JOURNAL)
TUESDAY, JULY 5, 1983
753
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES

O'Connor.
OPINIONS
No. 81-1717. American Bank and Trust Company, et al., Petitioners
v. Dallas County, et al.; Bank of Texas, et al., Petitioners v. John
Childs, et al.; and Wynnewood Bank & Trust, et al., Petitioners v. John
Childs, et al. On writ of certiorari to the Court of Appeals of Texas,
Fifth Supreme Judicial District. Judgments reversed and cases re-
manded to the Court of Appeals for further proceedings not inconsist-
ent with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by Justice Blackmun. Dis-
senting opinion by Justice Rehnquist with whom Justice Stevens joins.
Justice O'Connor took no part in the consideration or decision of these
cases.
No. 82-486. United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of Amer-
ica, Local 610, AFL-CIO, et al., Petitioners v. Paul E. Scott, et al. On
writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth
Circuit. Judgment reversed and case remanded to the Court of Appeals
for further proceedings in conformity with the opinion of this Court.
Opinion by Justice White announced by the Chief Justice. Dissenting
opinion by Justice Blackmun with whom Justice Brennan, Justice Mar-
shall, and Justice O'Connor join.
No. 81–1794. Everett W. Jones, Superintendent, Great Meadow Cor-
rectional Facility, et al., Petitioners v. David Barnes. On writ of certio-
rari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit. Judg-
ment reversed and case remanded to the Court of Appeals for further
proceedings in conformity with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by the
Chief Justice. Opinion by Justice Blackmun concurring in the judgment.
Dissenting opinion by Justice Brennan with whom Justice Marshall
joins.
No. 81-1843. Illinois, Petitioner v. John Andreas. On writ of certio-
rari to the Appellate Court of Illinois, First District. Judgment re-
versed and case remanded to the Appellate Court for further proceed-
ings not inconsistent with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by the
Chief Justice. Dissenting opinion by Justice Brennan with whom Jus-
tice Marshall joins. Dissenting opinion by Justice Stevens.

TUESDAY, JULY 5, 1983

to the Court of Appeals for further proceedings in conformity with the

The Chief Justice said:
"Tomorrow Wednesday, July 6, 1983, the Court will announce all the
remaining opinions ready for announcement during the Term of the
Court."

Adjourned until tomorrow at 10 o'clock.

WEDNESDAY, JULY 6, 1983
755
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES
Present: Chief Justice Burger, Justice Brennan, Justice Marshall,
Justice Blackmun, Justice Powell, Justice Stevens, and Justice
O'Connor.
OPINIONS
No. 82-6080. Thomas A. Barefoot, Petitioner v. W. J. Estelle, Jr.,
Director, Texas Department of Corrections. On writ of certiorari to the
United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit. Judgment of the
United States District Court for the Western District of Texas is af-
firmed. Opinion by Justice White announced by the Chief Justice. Opin-
ion by Justice Stevens concurring in the judgment. Dissenting opinion
by Justice Marshall with whom Justice Brennan joins. Dissenting opin-
ion by Justice Blackmun with whom Justice Brennan and Justice Mar-
shall join in Parts I through IV.
No. 81-1893. California, Petitioner v. Marcelino Ramos. On writ of
certiorari to the Supreme Court of California. Judgment reversed and
case remanded to the Supreme Court of California for further proceed-
ings not inconsistent with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by Justice
O'Connor. Dissenting opinion by Justice Marshall with whom Justice
Brennan joins and with whom Justice Blackmun joins in parts II
through V. Dissenting opinion by Justice Blackmun. Dissenting opinion
by Justice Stevens.
No. 82-256. Michigan, Petitioner v. David Kerk Long. On writ of cer-
tiorari to the Supreme Court of Michigan. Judgment reversed and case
remanded to the Supreme Court of Michigan for further proceedings
not inconsistent with the opinion of this Court. Opinion by Justice
O'Connor. Opinion by Justice Blackmun concurring in part and concur
ring in the judgment. Dissenting opinion by Justice Brennan with
whom Justice Marshall joins. Dissenting opinion by Justice Stevens.
No. 81–6908. Elwood Barclay, Petitioner v. Florida. On writ of cer-
tiorari to the Supreme Court of Florida. Judgment affirmed. The Chief
Justice announced that Justice Rehnquist announced the judgment of
the Court and delivered an opinion in which the Chief Justice, Justice
White, and Justice O'Connor joined. Opinion by Justice Stevens concur-
ring in the judgment with whom Justice Powell joins. Dissenting opin-
ion by Justice Marshall with whom Justice Brennan joins. Dissenting
opinion by Justice Blackmun.

756
WEDNESDAY, JULY 6, 1983
No. 82–52. Arizona Governing Committee for Tax Deferred Annuity
and Deferred Compensation Plans, etc., et al., Petitioners v. Nathalie
Norris, etc. On writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals
for the Ninth Circuit. Judgment affirmed in part, reversed in part, and
case remanded to the Court of Appeals for further proceedings in con-
formity with the opinion of this Court. The Clerk is directed to issue the
judgment August 1, 1983. Opinion per curiam announced by the Chief
Justice. Opinion by Justice Marshall concurring in the judgment in part
with whom Justice Brennan, Justice White, Justice Stevens, and Jus-
tice O'Connor join as to Parts I, II, and III, and with whom Justice
Brennan, Justice White, and Justice Stevens join as to Part IV. Opinion
by Justice Powell dissenting in part with whom the Chief Justice, Jus-
tice Blackmun, and Justice Rehnquist join as to Parts I and II, and with
whom the Chief Justice, Justice Blackmun, Justice Rehnquist, and Jus-
tice O'Connor join as to Part III, concurring in part. Concurring opinion
by Justice O'Connor.
OPINIONS PER CURIAM
No. 82-947. Illinois, Petitioner v. Milton D. Batchelder. On petition
for writ of certiorari to the Appellate Court of Illinois, Third District.
Petition for writ of certiorari granted. Judgment reversed and case re-
manded to the Appellate Court of Illinois for further proceedings not
inconsistent with the opinion of this Court. Opinion per curiam. Dis-
senting opinion by Justice Stevens with whom Justice Brennan and Jus-
tice Marshall join.
No. 82–1666. California, Petitioner v. Jerry Lain Beheler. On peti-
tion for writ of certiorari to the Court of Appeal of California, Fifth Ap-
pellate District. The motion of respondent for leave to proceed in forma
pauperis is granted. The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. Judg-
ment reversed and case remanded to the Court of Appeal for further
proceedings not inconsistent with the opinion of this Court. Opinion
per curiam. Dissenting opinion by Justice Stevens with whom Justice
Brennan and Justice Marshall join.

lar Tractor Co., et al. Appeal from the Supreme Court of Illinois. The
appeal is dismissed for want of a substantial federal question. Justice
Stevens took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.

County Board of Tax Assessors, et al. Appeal from the Supreme Court

757
of Georgia. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the

can Bank and Trust Company v. Dallas County, 463 U.S. (1983).
No. 81-2008. Process Gas Consumers Group, et al., Appellants v.
Consumer Energy Council of America, et al.;
No. 81-2020. Interstate Natural Gas Association of America, et al.,

in Nos. 82–177, 82–209, 82–935, and 82–1044, post. Justice Powell took

RECESS ORDER
The Court will take a recess from today until the first Monday in Oc-
tober, 1983, at which time the October 1982 Term will adjourn.
The Chief Justice said:
"Today's orders of the Court have been duly entered and certified
and filed with the Clerk. On that order list, Nos. 81–1687, Sony Cor-
poration v. Universal City Studios and 81-2101, Pennhurst State Hos-
pital v. Halderman are restored to the calendar for reargument. They
will not be otherwise announced. I am authorized to announce that all
cases submitted to the Court for decision and all other matters before

764
WEDNESDAY, JULY 6, 1983
the Court which were ready for disposition, have been acted upon by
the Court. Accordingly, it is ordered that those cases remaining on the
docket, but not ready for consideration, are hereby continued to the
Session of the Court beginning October 3 next. The Court will be in re-
cess from today until the first Monday in October, 1983, at which time
the October 1982 Term of the Court will be adjourned. The October
1983 Term of the Court will begin as provided by statute on the first
Monday in October. I wish to take this opportunity to thank the staff
for all the work that was done this Term. This has been one of the
heaviest case loads in the history of the Court."

ORDER IN PENDING CASE
No. 81-5698. Elmo Patrick Sonnier, petitioner v. Louisiana. The
application for suspension of the order of Court denying the petition for
a writ of certiorari pending the disposition of the petition for rehearing,
presented to Justice White and by him referred to the Court, is denied.
Justice Brennan and Justice Marshall would grant the application. The
Chief Justice and Justice O'Connor took no part in the consideration or
decision of this application.

WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 1, 1983
771
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES
Present: Chief Justice Burger, Justice Brennan, Justice White, Jus-
tice Marshall, Justice Blackmun, Justice Powell, Justice Rehnquist, Jus-
tice Stevens, and Justice O'Connor.
CERTIORARI DENIED
No. 83–5290. Jimmy Lee Gray, Petitioner v. Eddie Lucas, Warden,
et al. Petition for writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Ap-
peals for the Fifth Circuit denied. The application for stay of execu-
tion, scheduled for 12:01 a.m. on September 2, 1983, addressed to Jus-
tice Brennan and referred to the Court is denied. Opinion by the
Chief Justice concurring in the denial of the petition for writ of certio-
rari and in the denial of the application for stay. Dissenting opinion by
Justice Marshall with whom Justice Brennan joins. Justice Stevens
would grant the application for stay.

(JOURNAL)
THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 8, 1983
773
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES
Present: Chief Justice Burger, Justice Brennan, Justice White, Jus-
tice Marshall, Justice Blackmun, Justice Powell, Justice Rehnquist,
Justice Stevens, and Justice O'Connor.
ORDERS IN PENDING CASES
No. A-57. Burlington Northern Railroad Co., Applicant v. United
States, et al. The application for stay addressed to Justice White and by
him referred to the Court is denied.
No. 82-432. Local No. 82, Furniture and Piano Moving, Furniture
Store Drivers, Helpers, Warehousemen and Packers, et al., Petitioners
v. Jerome Crowley, et al. The motion of Association for Union Democ-
racy for leave to file a brief as amicus curiae is granted.
No. 82–629. Three Affiliated Tribes of the Fort Berthold Reserva-
tion, Petitioners v. Wold Engineering, P.C., et al. The motion of Stand-
ing Rock Sioux Tribe of North and South Dakota, et al. for leave to file
a brief as amici curiae is granted. The motion of Turtle Mountain Band
of Chippewa Indians for leave to file a brief as amicus curiae is
granted. The motion of the Solicitor General for leave to participate in
oral argument as amicus curiae and for divided argument is granted.
No. 82-708. Summa Corporation, Petitioner v. California ex rel.
State Lands Commission and City of Los Angeles. The motion of Ami-
gos de Bolsa Chica for leave to file a brief as amicus curiae is granted.
No. 82–945. Sure-Tan, Inc. and Surak Leather Company, Petitioners
v. National Labor Relations Board. The motion of California Agricul-
tural Labor Relations Board for leave to file a brief as amicus curiae is
granted. The motion of United Farm Workers i America, AFL-CIO,
for leave to file a brief as amicus curiae is granted.
No. 82–1071. Aluminum Company of America, et al., Petitioners v.
Central Lincoln Peoples' Utility District, et al. The motion of the Solici-
tor General for divided argument is granted.
No. 82-1095. R. Pulley, Warden, Petitioner v. Robert Alton Harris.
The motion of The National Council on Crime and Delinquency for leave
to file a brief as amicus curiae is granted.
No. 82-1326. James G. Watt, Secretary of the Interior, et al., Peti-
tioners v. California, et al.;
No. 82-1327. Western Oil and Gas Association, et al., Petitioners v.
California, etc., et al.; and

774
THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 8, 1983
No. 82-1511. California, et al., Petitioners v. James G. Watt, Secre-
tary of the Interior, et al. The motion of Western Oil and Gas Associa-
tion, et al. for divided argument is granted. The request for additional
time for oral argument is denied. The motion of Humboldt County, et
al. for divided argument is granted. The request for additional time for
oral argument is denied.

(JOURNAL)
TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 27, 1983
807
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES
Present: Chief Justice Burger, Justice Brennan, Justice White, Jus-
tice Marshall, Justice Blackmun, Justice Powell, Justice Rehnquist,
Justice Stevens, and Justice O'Connor.
ORDERS IN PENDING CASES
No. 81-2101. Pennhurst State School and Hospital, et al., Petitioners
v. Terri Lee Halderman, et al. The motion of respondents to dismiss the
writ of certiorari as improvidently granted is denied.
No. 83-5432. Timothy George Baldwin, Petitioner v. Ross Maggio,
Warden, Louisiana State Penitentiary and William J. Guste, Attorney
General of Louisiana. The application for stay of execution of the sen-
tence of death scheduled for October 6, 1983, presented to Justice
White and by him referred to the Court, is granted pending this Court's
final action on the petition for writ of certiorari.
